questions.question: Have you lost ………………………… marbles?
questions.description: Your, his, her, our and their are possessive adjectives. They are used before nouns.

questions.question: This is my bag. Which one is …………………………………?
questions.description: The words yours, his, hers, ours and theirs are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: My composition is better than ………………………………
questions.description: The words yours, his, hers, ours and theirs are possessive pronouns. They are used alone.

questions.question: She is taller than ………………………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after than.

questions.question: I have invited all of ……………………………. to my party.
questions.description: Object pronouns are used after a preposition.

questions.question: I have never had the opportunity to meet any one of ……………………………
questions.description: Object pronouns are used after a preposition.

questions.question: We went to ……………………………. native place last week.
questions.description: Your, his, her, our and their are possessive adjectives. They are used before nouns.
